item.title: 美国报纸起诉 OpenAI 侵犯人工智能训练版权
item.description: 周二，包括《纽约每日新闻》和《芝加哥论坛报》在内的一批报纸在纽约联邦法院起诉微软和 OpenAI，指控它们滥用记者的作品来训练其人工智能生成系统。【原文：A group of newspapers, including the New York Daily News and Chicago Tribune, sued Microsoft and OpenAI in New York federal court on Tuesday, accusing them of misusing reporters' work to train their generative artificial-intelligence systems.】

item.title: 美国劳工官员呼吁企业撤离中国新疆
item.description: 美国劳工部官员周二表示，由于存在强迫劳动问题，国际公司不能负责任地在新疆运营，应离开中国西部地区。【原文：International companies cannot responsibly operate in Xinjiang and should leave the western Chinese region due to forced labor concerns, a U.S. Labor Department official said on Tuesday.】

item.title: 为美联储浅度宽松做准备，债券投资者走曲线中间道路
item.description: 由于美联储在本周的政策会议上决定维持利率不变，投资者押注美联储将推迟降息，且降息速度将慢于以往的宽松周期，因此债券投资者正有选择地在其投资组合中增加较长期限的债券。【原文：Bond investors are selectively adding longer-dated maturities to their portfolios on bets the Federal Reserve will delay cutting interest rates and reduce them at a slower pace than in previous easing cycles, starting with a decision to stand pat on rates at this week's policy meeting.】

item.title: 恩桥公司为其五大湖隧道项目选择承包商
item.description: 加拿大能源公司 Enbridge 周二发表声明称，该公司已聘请巴纳德建筑公司（Barnard Construction Company, Inc.【原文：Canadian energy company Enbridge has retained a joint venture partnership between Barnard Construction Company, Inc. and Civil and Building North America, Inc (CBNA). to construct the Great Lakes Tunnel in the Straits of Mackinac, the company said in a statement on Tuesday.】

item.title: 康卡斯特旗下的 Peacock 将在巴黎奥运会前提高流媒体价格
item.description: 孔雀（Peacock）是康卡斯特（Comcast）旗下 NBC 环球公司的流媒体服务，它将把其高级和高级附加计划的价格每月提高 2 美元，因为它希望从今年夏天巴黎奥运会的流媒体转播权中套现。【原文：Peacock, a Comcast-owned NBCUniversal's streaming service, will raise prices of its premium and premium plus plans by $2 per month, as it looks to cash in on its streaming rights to the Olympic Games in Paris this summer.】

item.title: 富国银行投资者批准高管薪酬，首席执行官强调风险控制
item.description: 富国银行股东周二以多数票通过了高管薪酬计划，包括将首席执行官查理-沙尔夫 2023 年的薪酬提高到 2900 万美元。【原文：Wells Fargo shareholders on Tuesday approved its plans for executive compensation with a majority vote, including hiking CEO Charlie Scharf's 2023 package to $29 million.】

item.title: 前谷歌员工称因抗议以色列合同而被解雇是非法的
item.description: Alphabet 公司旗下谷歌公司的一群员工向美国劳工委员会提出申诉，称这家科技公司因抗议与以色列政府签订云合同而非法解雇了他们。【原文：A group of workers at Alphabet Inc's Google have filed a complaint with a U.S. labor board claiming the tech company unlawfully fired them for protesting its cloud contract with the Israeli government.】

item.title: Ancora 在诺福克南方公司代理权争夺战中获得 ISS 支持，取得胜利
item.description: 本周二，著名代理咨询公司机构股东服务公司（ISS）建议股东选举该激进对冲基金的五名董事候选人，Ancora Holdings 在与诺福克南方公司的斗争中取得了第二次胜利。【原文：Ancora Holdings scored a second victory in its battle with Norfolk Southern when prominent proxy advisory firm Institutional Shareholder Services (ISS) recommended on Tuesday that shareholders elect five of the activist hedge fund's director candidates.】

item.title: 贝莱德将推出由 PIF 支持的沙特投资平台
item.description: 全球最大的资产管理公司贝莱德（BlackRock）周二表示，计划在沙特阿拉伯推出一个新的投资平台，由沙特主权财富基金公共投资基金（PIF）提供高达 50 亿美元的资金支持。【原文：The world's largest asset manager BlackRock said on Tuesday it plans to launch a new investment platform in Saudi Arabia, backed by up to $5 billion from Saudi sovereign wealth fund the Public Investment Fund (PIF).】

item.title: 独家报道：消息人士称，标普全球正在权衡移动业务部门的各种选择
item.description: 三位知情人士告诉路透社，金融信息公司 S&P Global 正在权衡其移动业务的各种选择，包括全面出售。【原文：Financial information firm S&P Global is weighing options for its mobility business, including a full sale, three people with knowledge of the matter told Reuters.】

item.title: 摩根大通拓宽销售主管的职责范围
item.description: 摩根大通在路透社周二看到的一份内部备忘录中表示，该行已经扩大了销售部门一些高管的职责。【原文：JPMorgan Chase has expanded the roles of some executives in its sales department, the bank said in an internal memo seen by Reuters on Tuesday.】

item.title: 汇丰在突击物色首席执行官时必须优先考虑亚洲专长
item.description: 在首席执行官诺埃尔-奎因（Noel Quinn）的领导下，汇丰银行经受住了全球大流行病的考验，并在反叛投资者的推动下解散了这家拥有 160 年历史的银行。投资者称，他的意外离职为汇丰加速向亚洲转移战略重心提供了机会。【原文：Under Chief Executive Noel Quinn, HSBC navigated a global pandemic and a push by rebel investors to break up the 160-year bank. His surprise departure is an opportunity to accelerate its strategic pivot to Asia, investors say.】

item.title: Glass Lewis 建议投资者投票反对波音公司的三名董事
item.description: 代理权咨询公司 Glass Lewis 周二建议股东投票反对 Dave Calhoun、Akhil Johri 和 David Joyce 三位董事进入飞机制造商波音公司的董事会。【原文：Proxy advisory firm Glass Lewis on Tuesday recommended shareholders vote against the election of three directors - Dave Calhoun, Akhil Johri and David Joyce - to planemaker Boeing's board.】

item.title: 联盟宣布与凯雷就蒂森克虏伯船舶系统公司多数股权进行谈判
item.description: 德国 IG Metall 工会周二表示，已与凯雷就该投资公司收购蒂森克虏伯船舶系统公司多数股权一事进行了初步谈判，并同意尽快推动双方达成协议。【原文：Germany's IG Metall union on Tuesday said it had preliminary talks with Carlyle on the investment firm taking a majority stake in Thyssenkrupp Marine Systems and agreed to push for an agreement as quickly as possible.】

item.title: 欧元区从衰退中反弹，通胀趋于稳定
item.description: 随着德国经济恢复增长，欧元区经济在第一季度从温和衰退中反弹，其他地区的经济扩张也在加速，同时通胀趋于稳定，加强了欧洲中央银行降息的理由。【原文：The euro zone economy rebounded in the first quarter from a mild recession as Germany returned to growth and expansion accelerated elsewhere, while inflation steadied to reinforce the case for the European Central Bank to cut interest rates.】

item.title: 花旗集团首席执行官称美国消费者对消费变得更加谨慎
item.description: 花旗集团首席执行官简-弗雷泽（Jane Fraser）表示，美国消费者在消费方面正变得更加谨慎，购买金额也越来越小。【原文：Citigroup CEO Jane Fraser said U.S. consumers are becoming more cautious with their spending, making smaller purchases.】

item.title: 中国恒大推迟发布2023年年度业绩
item.description: 陷入困境的房地产开发商中国恒大集团表示，由于清算人需要时间来 "确定 "这家资金短缺公司的 "现状"，因此将推迟公布其年度业绩。【原文：Embattled property developer China Evergrande Group flagged a delay in publishing its annual results as its liquidators are taking time to "ascertain the current state of affairs" of the cash-strapped company.】

item.title: 美国 4 月份消费者信心指数下降
item.description: 周二的一项调查显示，由于对劳动力市场和收入的担忧，4月份美国消费者信心恶化，降至1年半以来的最低水平。【原文：U.S. consumer confidence deteriorated in April, falling to its lowest level in more than 1-1/2 years amid worries about the labor market and income, a survey showed on Tuesday.】

item.title: 巴西 3 月份新增就业岗位超出预期，预示经济活动将更加强劲
item.description: 巴西 3 月份创造的正式工作岗位远高于预期，这加强了今年年初经济活动将更加强劲的观点。【原文：Brazil's creation of formal jobs in March came in well above expectations, reinforcing the view of a stronger economic activity at the beginning of this year.】

item.title: 沃伦-巴菲特的 PacifiCorp 公司面临 300 亿美元的新野火索赔
item.description: 沃伦-巴菲特（Warren Buffett）的伯克希尔-哈撒韦公司（Berkshire Hathaway）旗下的一家公用事业公司面临着 300 亿美元的新索赔，指责其在 2020 年造成了俄勒冈州的野火，几乎是其预计最大损失的四倍。【原文：A utility owned by Warren Buffett's Berkshire Hathaway faces $30 billion of new claims blaming it for causing Oregon wildfires in 2020, nearly four times the maximum loss it had projected.】

item.title: 据 The Information 报道，谷歌将向新闻集团支付高达 600 万美元的新人工智能内容费用
item.description: 据 Information 周二报道，Alphabet 旗下的谷歌已同意每年向《华尔街日报》的所有者新闻集团支付 500 万至 600 万美元，用于开发新的人工智能相关内容和产品。【原文：Alphabet-owned Google has agreed to pay News Corp , owner of the Wall Street Journal, between $5 million and $6 million annually to develop new AI-related content and products, the Information reported on Tuesday.】

item.title: 康宁预计第二季度核心销售额高于预期，因运营商支出稳定
item.description: 特种玻璃生产商康宁公司周二预计，第二季度核心销售额将高于华尔街预期，这主要得益于价格上涨和电信客户支出复苏对其光纤电缆的健康需求。【原文：Specialty glass maker Corning forecast second-quarter core sales above Wall Street expectations on Tuesday, banking on price increases and healthy demand for its fiber optic cables amid recovery in spending from telecom clients.】

item.title: 美国联邦住房管理局（FHFA）称，2 月份美国房价创近两年来最大涨幅
item.description: 美国联邦住房管理局周二发布报告称，2月份美国房价创下近两年来的最大涨幅，反映出房屋供应不足继续对美国住房市场造成影响。【原文：U.S. home prices leapt in February by the most in nearly two years, federal housing authorities reported on Tuesday, reflecting the effects that lean home supply continue to have on the nation's housing market.】

item.title: 食品分销商 Sysco 因消费疲软，季度销售额不及预期
item.description: 食品分销商 Sysco 周二公布的第三季度销售额低于预期，原因是消费者减少了可自由支配的开支，导致需求受到影响。【原文：Food distributor Sysco fell short of third-quarter sales expectations on Tuesday as demand took a hit from consumers scaling back discretionary spending.】

item.title: 美国第一季度劳动力成本增幅高于预期
item.description: 由于工资和福利的增加，第一季度美国劳动力成本的增长超过了预期，证实了年初通胀率的飙升。【原文：U.S. labor costs increased more than expected in the first quarter amid a rise in wages and benefits, confirming the surge in inflation early in the year.】

item.title: 通胀尚未失去对债券市场的控制力
item.description: 发达经济体的政府借贷成本在 4 月份出现了几个月来的最大涨幅，这表明债券市场尚未摆脱通胀和利率长期高于预期的威胁。【原文：Government borrowing costs across developed economies saw their biggest jumps in months in April, evidence that bond markets are not yet out of the woods when it comes to inflation and the threat of higher-for-longer than expected interest rates.】

item.title: 马丁玛丽埃塔公司第一季度利润超出预期
item.description: 建筑材料公司马丁玛丽埃塔材料公司（Martin Marietta Materials）周二公布的第一季度利润高于预期，原因是成本削减帮助抵消了住房活动放缓带来的冲击。【原文：Construction material firm Martin Marietta Materials on Tuesday topped first-quarter profit estimates after cost cuts helped offset a hit from a slowdown in housing activity.】

item.title: 中国市场疲软，通用电气医疗保健公司季度收入不及预期
item.description: 本周二，通用电气医疗保健技术公司（GE HealthCare Technologies）第一季度营收未达预期，受中国市场销售额下降和扫描设备需求低于预期的影响，该公司股价在收盘前暴跌达 12%。【原文：GE HealthCare Technologies missed first-quarter revenue estimates on Tuesday, hurt by lower sales in China market and weaker-than-expected demand for its scanning devices, sending its shares tumbling as much as 12% before the bell.】

item.title: 支出保持弹性，利润率提高，PayPal 上调 2024 年利润预期
item.description: PayPal 周二上调了全年调整后利润预期，原因是这家支付巨头受益于强劲的消费支出，同时削减成本的措施提高了第一季度的运营利润率。【原文：PayPal raised its full-year adjusted profit forecast on Tuesday, as the payments giant benefited from robust consumer spending, while measures to cut costs improved operating margins in the first quarter.】

item.title: 沃尔玛将关闭 51 家美国医疗中心
item.description: 沃尔玛周二表示，公司计划关闭美国五个州的 51 家医疗中心，并关闭虚拟护理中心，以优化其在美国的业务运营。【原文：Walmart said on Tuesday it plans to close 51 health centers across five states in the U.S., as well as shut virtual care centers, as the company looks to optimize its business operations in the country.】
